result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

OTP canceled per email communication from Waukesha Co. defendant is sick and cannot be transported.  Attempted to contact both the State and Defense counsel about this.  State had no objection to canceling the OTP but never heard back from defense counsel.  Court will keep the 10/31 Hearing just to address scheduling and defendant will not be present.

For the 10/12/20222 Hearing for the defendant.  Return to sender, undeliverable as addressed, unable to forward.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:18 AM Defendant Robert M Janzen appeared by Zoom from the Joshua Glover Treatment Center with attorney Angela Wang.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  This case is tagging along with the defendant's felony matter.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victims/witnesses/businesses listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
